definition: banner/flag/(in Qing times) Manchu (cf. 八旗[Ba1 qi2])/administrative subdivision in inner Mongolia equivalent to 縣|县[xian4] county/CL:面[mian4]
to show one's colors/to have a clear-cut stand (idiom)

sentences.english: Firecrackers exploded, flags flew high, and cars honked wildly.
sentences.chinese: 炮聲陣陣，旗幟飛揚，就連汽車的喇叭都摁得朝天響。

sentences.english: He is draping the banner from the balcony.
sentences.chinese: 他使旗幟成褶皺狀從陽臺上垂下。

sentences.english: A national flag is always flown higher than other flags.
sentences.chinese: 國旗永遠都要升於別的旗幟之上。

sentences.english: National sovereignty was previously a standard held aloft mainly by British eurosceptics.
sentences.chinese: 以前，國家主權主要是英國“疑歐派”高舉的旗幟。

sentences.english: Flag issue is radical, and route issue is relating to overall phase.
sentences.chinese: 旗幟問題至關重要，道路問題事關全局。

sentences.english: There goes the games' one-world slogan, " he says."
sentences.chinese: 旗幟上寫着“同一個世界”。

sentences.english: The apartment flag is gold lion rampant on a field of azure.
sentences.chinese: 公寓旗幟是一頭在天藍色背景下兩腿站立的獅子。

sentences.english: Shield and Heraldic Mail with Surcoat show your custom banner.
sentences.chinese: 泡菜裏那個定義旗幟的功能。

sentences.english: Jute uprise is banner of brightness of one side of viatic of success of exploration China revolution.
sentences.chinese: 黃麻起義是探索中國革命成功道路的一面光輝旗幟。

sentences.english: When their flags and banners move about chaotically , they can be attacked.
sentences.chinese: 旗幟混亂搖動，顯得舉起不定，可以攻擊。

sentences.english: Traditionally, eight people carry in the flag at the Opening Ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 傳統上，在開幕典禮上會有八個人運送旗幟進入會場。

sentences.english: Use this to simulate randomly changing forces on the cloth, such as wind turbulences waving a flag.
sentences.chinese: 用這個來模擬隨機大小的力，如隨風飄揚的旗幟。

sentences.english: And, report about a grand old flag's new home.
sentences.chinese: 並且報道一些關於偉大舊旗幟的新家園。

sentences.english: Above all the fragrant wood were hung banners of five colours.
sentences.chinese: 香木之上掛着五種顏色的旗幟。

sentences.english: The many flags lend colur to the streets.
sentences.chinese: 這許許多多旗幟給街道增添了色彩。

definition: to resist/to make a stand and fight (against)
model or template character/written slogan or phrase/mention (e.g. "air mail" 航空 on a letter, "first draft" 初稿 on a document etc)
